author: snjpeters
title: Enterprise Operating System
description: It is hard to run a company, and it is a waste of resources that new companies need to relearn everything.

f6_assessments.q0:
The propose 3 clear main features of their product helping the targeted audience (business owners) to successfully build their business. They also clearly update about their current partner (the Resourceful Human GMbH) and state that this solution is independent of their Waya Collective, which helps the community have a better understanding of the scale of the project and therefore better evaluate their solution. 

The expected results are also believed to have direct impacts on Cardano by enabling companies to engage Cardano-based B2B services and therefore, increasing the B2B adoption of Cardano. These results are well aligned with the objectives of the challenge.

The main challenges when activating the project are well foreseen by the team. They also follow up with some practical solutions, which means they are fully prepared for the unexpected. This can help them have a strategic plan to maximize project outcomes
f6_assessments.q1:
Their action plan is well presented with 3 main milestones and the tasks included. They also build their own networking organization to manage the work and ensure to share everything with the Cardano community. The community can easily see the clarity of the project and the team’s professionalism in operating their solution.
The team has described their budget planning, essential cots for operating are provided. This will allow the community to see how they spend money and examine the effectiveness of this spending on the development of the project.
The team is well portrayed including internal (the proposers) and external (partners) members. Each member is presented with relevant working experiences, education, and their position in the project. Their LinkedIn account is also provided for the community if there are any future references needed. Their team is considered strong and has a huge capacity to effectively run the project.
f6_assessments.q2: Their milestones and KPI s for measuring the project’s development are mentioned in the proposal. They are also well in tune with their project’s objectives and specific to track and follow. These indicators will help the community get an overview of how their project is performing. Their definition of success is easy to understand. They need to properly anwer 4 main questions related to the expected results from the project. This will help the teaam stay on track and make quick adjustment if there is any sign of failure.

f6_assessments.q0: This project proposal is to put in place an HR system that can help in managing smaller companies. Which fits in with this B2B challenge hopefully helping grow the community
f6_assessments.q1:
The fact that the project is already up and running in providing HR management systems B2B makes the success of this project highly predictable. Also half of the fund will be be provided by the team while the remaining 50% of the funding will be from  catalyst. The project proposed will help link the system to Cardano. 
The existing pool of customers make this project goals easier to achieve and the timeline provided seems achievable and clear.
f6_assessments.q2: Simple tools like surveys to insure customer satisfaction and follow up’s with the customers are easy ways to audit. With goals that are listed clearly its easy to follow up on the success.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal focused on creating a solution for business owners. It listed three core features of the proposed products that help meet the demand of new companies. This is what the challenge required in coming up with Cardano-based solutions to satisfy business needs.This project is also a part of the cooperation with the Resourceful Human GmbH based in Berlin, which is aligned with the Key Metrics of the challenge of partnerships created between companies. The proposal also explained how this solution will impact and facilitate the adoption of Cardano through creating on-chain entities.Two popular challenges were realized. One is the lack of knowledge related to Cardano/Blockchain. The other is the incapability to change due to cost issues.  This proposal suggested a way to overcome the challenge by accompanying the firm to set up on Cardano and grow with them, but details about it were not stated. Therefore, If it described how they go together with the firm at the beginning and how long this will take, then everything would be more persuasive.
f6_assessments.q1: A plan with different steps and phases to be executed was mentioned. However, there are some steps that are not limited by a period of time to complete, like how long it will take to do that step.A detail of how the budget would be allocated was not clearly stated. It just included the cost for lead developers and supporting developers, but other operating fees were not mentioned. Therefore, a more detailed list of budget distribution should be included so that sponsors could evaluate the possibility of executing this project that does not waste much capital. A team needed to run this project was listed with many years of experience, but it should include more detail about these people to see how suitable they are to this project.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal provided a clear expected outcome. Also, it cited milestones users to make it easy for people to audit this project. However, this could be improved by adding the timeline for each milestone so that it could be more measurable. This proposal also did not confirm whether this is a totally new proposal that has not been funded before or this is a continuation of a previously funded project.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is well-written, with a defined specific goal and a well-stated problem. This project, as claimed by the author, is essential to the development of the Waya Collective. The team hopes to establish an operating system that includes three key features for businesses: transparent governance, access to Defi, and efficient bookkeeping. It appears to me that the relationship between this proposal goal and the challenge setting is very obvious. Furthermore, the anticipated impact implementation, along with a well-thought-out description of how it works, makes everything appear solid and accurate. Furthermore, there is a mention of possible issues, which I believe is appropriate. However, I would have liked to see the team demonstrate a clear method or approach to attracting the attention of other companies and make them join despite their “lack of knowledge” and “inability to change”. For instance, it is claimed in the proposal that large organizations have considerable switching costs, so how does the team intend to tackle this for the better? In summary, if the implementation of what is proposed here were to be implemented, it should offer some more detailed mention above to grow confidence in people who are interested. I personally love the idea and wish the team all the best.
f6_assessments.q1: The team experience mentioned here is too vague and could have more details - both of the team as a whole and the individuals on it, with their resumes and possibly links or ways to verify their capabilities. The roadmap is quite understandable but the timeline is not, as well as no defined milestones to make the project traceable. It would be greatly beneficial if there is a well-described plan on how to assess the stated goal of each phase and provide a more transparent vision of where the project is after a specific interval. There's a high level budget breakdown but more details on it could also be offered. Since the budget will be allocated solely on developer staff, it could provide additional information on: how many hours per week/month they work, what task to do to be exact, etc. This would help to understand the rationale behind the number and check its fairness. In terms of viability, I disagree that the proposal provides me with sufficient information to believe in its successful implementation.
f6_assessments.q2: There are no specified metrics with targets or intermediate milestones. If the proposer intends to "Getting the working group from 10 to 50, 100, 150 people working as an intent driven network," there should be a calculated plan, for example, a timeframe separated into 3 months, 6 months, and 12 months to progressively accomplish those predicted numbers. The final deliverables could also be presented with more specifics or a more plain approach to measure/evaluate them as it is a bit subjective and can have numerous restrictions of success. Moreover, what is the promised transparent Notion Page? Is it easily accessible to everyone, or only auditors? As a result, I would encourage the proposer to identify some additional KPIs that would allow the Cardano community to audit the proposal with greater confidence.

f6_assessments.q0:
The aim of the proposal is to build a management interface with Cardano’s multi sig wallet as the basis for it, on top of which an advanced governance layer can be built. As such, at its core it will be the structural basis of emerging companies, who will be willing to adopt this operating system for the start-up of their business. Other important features of the interface will be: a contribution reward system, decision making, access to DeFi and efficient bookkeeping.
The project has the potential to ease the onboarding of emerging businesses, looking to build their companies as DAOs and as such, will be considering the Cardano blockchain, not only thanks to the decentralisation and fast transaction speeds with low fees, but also due to the already existing tools been built to speed up the process.
f6_assessments.q1:
The detailed plan and timeline are interwoven, the timeframe for the completion of the project goes until 12 months after funding, ending with the publishing of their findings and an open source version of their platform.
The budget seem realistic, half of the needed amount will be supported by the proposing team themselves. However, the breakdown is not sufficient, and a number of hours coupled with the needed skills would have greatly improved the feasibility of the entire budget.
The team members have provided ample descriptions about themselves, coupled with social profile links for verification. The only team member who has not provided a link is the lead developer, who in the case of this proposal, is one of the most important persons in the endeavour.
f6_assessments.q2:
The progress measurement offers sufficient information and a method for the community to assess the advancement through a “transparent Notion Page”.
The success of the project is elaborate, with several KPIs clearly described, though some of them could have benefited from having identifiable milestones, like “Basic governance structure” which does not offer any concrete measurements, that the community could assess independently.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is to create a HR operating system to manage small companies. This fits well within the B2B proposals and will help grow the community. I have not understood very well the connection to cardano and catalyst in detail it might need to be clarified in the future.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team is funding 50% of this project and will use catalyst to fund the other 50%. Waya is a working company that is providing B2B solutions for HR management systems. The catalyst fund will help link this system to cardano. 
The timeline and goal set by the proposer is well defined and acheivable. And since they have existing cutomers onboarding might be much simpler to implement.
f6_assessments.q2: The overall goals are clearly listed and can be acheived. To audit this project would need simple customer satisfaction survery and a followup on the progress onchain using the system that the proposer will establish.

solution: An operating system that guides the building of successful groups and business administration.
experience: We as a team have led and participated in a vast variety of successful groups: From small high tech startups to factories with thousands of employees. Beyond us, Resourceful Humans, a company dedicated to creating better organizations, is included in the project development.
